page.title: 18Transport:Nether & O.Silton
page.content: The local bus service is very limited running only once every week (Mondays) to the market in Thirsk,7 miles away. It was therefore not surprising that we found only one household without a car (there being no shops locally).15% of households had 3 cars,40% 2 cars & the remainder one. The Al9 dual carriageway runs to the west of the area 2 miles from the villages of Nether & Over Silton providing easy access to Teesside to the North & York to the South.Access to the A19 is occasionally thwarted in the winter as snow ploughing & gritting are being reduced owing to shortage of finance. A new shared Car Hire/Taxi Service is proposed to run "on demand" to Thirsk on Tuesday,Thursday & Friday mornings operated by the North Yorkshire County Council.
